DataElement.preferredName: Dental Implant Patient Diet Interruption Oral Health Impact Profile Physical Examination Oral Health Impact Profile Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a scaled index related to the Oral Health Impact Profile assessment, a measure of a person's perceptions of the social impact of oral disorders on their well-being, of a patient's time interval during which there is a temporary cessation in the things a person eats and drinks from the materials placed into (endosseous) or onto (subperiosteal) the jawbone.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dental Implant Patient Diet Interruption Oral Health Impact Profile Physical Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the Oral Health Impact Profile assessment, a measure of a person's perceptions of the social impact of oral disorders on their well-being, of a patient's time interval during which there is a temporary cessation in the things a person eats and drinks from the materials placed into (endosseous) or onto (subperiosteal) the jawbone.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Materials placed into (endosseous) or onto (subperiosteal) the jawbone; commonly used to support a crown, bridge, artificial tooth, stabilize a diseased tooth, or to use as anchorage in orthodontic therapy.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: Materials placed into (endosseous) or onto (subperiosteal) the jawbone; commonly used to support a crown, bridge, artificial tooth, stabilize a diseased tooth, or to use as anchorage in orthodontic therapy.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Diet Interruption Oral Health Impact Profile Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition:
Regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person or animal. This does not include DIET THERAPY, a specific diet prescribed in the treatment of a disease.:Interruption; a time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.:Measures a person's perceptions of the social impact of oral disorders on their well-being; measures
self-reported dysfunction, discomfort and disability attributed to oral conditions.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health.
A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.
Measures a person's perceptions of the social impact of oral disorders on their well-being; measures self-reported dysfunction, discomfort and disability attributed to oral conditions.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a scaled index of the social impact of oral disorders which draws on a theoretical heirarchy of  oral health outcomes (Oral Health Impact Profile).

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
